New Records: Lockie Ferguson bowled four maidens, becoming the first player to do so at the Twenty20 World Cup and the second in T20 history.
Key Match Events: Trent Boult and Tim Southee shared the new ball, with Southee removing PNG opener Tony Ura in his first over.
Lockie Ferguson struck with his first ball and finished with figures of 3-0, conceding only two leg byes.
Tim Southee and Trent Boult returned to take more wickets, with Southee finishing with 2-11 and Boult with 2-14.
Ish Sodhi took the last two wickets in the final over, finishing with 2-29.
New Zealand chased down the target with contributions from Devon Conway (35 off 32), Kane Williamson (18 not out), and Daryl Mitchell (19 off 12).
Post-Match Reflections: Trent Boult expressed mixed emotions about finishing the tournament and his Twenty20 international career in a group game.
Boult reflected on his partnership with Tim Southee, highlighting their long-standing friendship and success together.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was delayed by rain for more than an hour.
New Zealand finished third in their group after back-to-back wins against Uganda and Papua New Guinea.
